# ğŸš€ **Pizza Deal Finder Automation â€“ Breakdown** This workflow automatically **scrapes Uber Eats for pizza deals**, **extracts the names and discounts**, and **emails the best offers** to you â€” all without writing any complex code! --- ## ğŸŸ¢ **SECTION 1: ğŸ” Trigger & ğŸŒ Fetch Pizza Deals Page** ### ğŸ”¹ Nodes Included: 1. âš¡ **Trigger Workflow** 2. ğŸŒ **Fetch Uber Eats Search Page (Bright Data)** --- ### ğŸ”§ What Happens Here: * **âš¡ Trigger Workflow**: This node is the starting point. You can configure it to run: * On-demand (when you click "Execute") * On a schedule (e.g., every morning or every 4 hours) * **ğŸŒ Fetch Uber Eats Search Page**: * Sends a `POST` request to **Bright Dataâ€™s Web Unlocker API** to access UberEats. * It bypasses JavaScript-heavy pages and bot protections. * URL targeted: something like `https://www.ubereats.com/search?query=pizza` * Returns full HTML of the results page with all pizza restaurant names and their deals. ### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» For Beginners: * This is the **scraping engine** of your workflow. * Bright Data does the heavy lifting (proxying, unblocking, rendering). * You only need to provide your **Bright Data API key** and the target URL. --- ## ğŸŸ¡ **SECTION 2: ğŸ§¹ Extract Pizza Names & Deals** ### ğŸ”¹ Node Included: * ğŸ§© **Extract Names & Deals** --- ### ğŸ”§ What Happens Here: * This is the **HTML Extract** node. * It scans the raw HTML from the previous step and pulls: * ğŸ·ï¸ Restaurant names (e.g., â€œDominoâ€™sâ€) * ğŸ’¸ Deals or special offers (e.g., â€œFree Item on \$9 Spendâ€) ### ğŸ› ï¸ CSS Selectors Used: * **Name Selector**: `div.be.f3.bg.f2.ck.bp.bn.k2` â†’ extracts all names * **Deal Selector**: `div.hr.bn.k2` â†’ extracts all visible deals âš™ï¸ You configure it to **get all matches**, not just one. This ensures multiple restaurants are included. ### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» For Beginners: * This is where **the magic happens** â€” HTML becomes readable data. * No coding is required â€” just CSS selectors you can get from â€œInspect Elementâ€ in Chrome. * You can reuse this for other platforms like DoorDash or Grubhub by updating the selectors. --- ## ğŸ”´ **SECTION 3: ğŸ“§ Send Best Deals via Gmail** ### ğŸ”¹ Node Included: * âœ‰ï¸ **Send Pizza Deals via Gmail** --- ### ğŸ”§ What Happens Here: * Sends you an email (or to any recipient you define). * The email includes: * ğŸ§¾ List of pizza restaurants * ğŸ Associated deals ğŸ“¬ You can customize the subject and message format using simple templates: ```html

ğŸ• Todayâ€™s Top Pizza Deals

    {{#each items}}
  • {{this.title}} â€” {{this.deal}}
    • {{/each}}
``` ### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» For Beginners: * This turns your data into a **daily email alert**. * You can plug in **Gmail, Outlook, Telegram, Slack**, etc. * Use this to stay updated or forward to your group of friends or a Discord bot. --- ## âœ¨ Final Thoughts | âœ… Feature | ğŸ’¡ Benefit | | ---------------------------- | --------------------------------------- | | Fully visual | No coding knowledge needed | | Web Unlocker via Bright Data | Access any site without getting blocked | | HTML Extraction | Pull exactly what you need | | Email Integration | Automatically get results | This is a **production-grade workflow** thatâ€™s easy to understand, scalable, and customizable for other food types, locations, or platforms. ---

parameters.content:
## ğŸŸ¢ **SECTION 1: ğŸ” Trigger & ğŸŒ Fetch Pizza Deals Page**

### ğŸ”¹ Nodes Included:

1. âš¡ **Trigger Workflow**
2. ğŸŒ **Fetch Uber Eats Search Page (Bright Data)**

---

### ğŸ”§ What Happens Here:

* **âš¡ Trigger Workflow**: This node is the starting point. You can configure it to run:

  * On-demand (when you click "Execute")
  * On a schedule (e.g., every morning or every 4 hours)

* **ğŸŒ Fetch Uber Eats Search Page**:

  * Sends a `POST` request to **Bright Dataâ€™s Web Unlocker API** to access UberEats.
  * It bypasses JavaScript-heavy pages and bot protections.
  * URL targeted: something like `https://www.ubereats.com/search?query=pizza`
  * Returns full HTML of the results page with all pizza restaurant names and their deals.

### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» For Beginners:

* This is the **scraping engine** of your workflow.
* Bright Data does the heavy lifting (proxying, unblocking, rendering).
* You only need to provide your **Bright Data API key** and the target URL.

---

## ğŸŸ¡ **SECTION 2: ğŸ§¹ Extract Pizza Names & Deals**

### ğŸ”¹ Node Included:

* ğŸ§© **Extract Names & Deals**

---

### ğŸ”§ What Happens Here:

* This is the **HTML Extract** node.
* It scans the raw HTML from the previous step and pulls:

  * ğŸ·ï¸ Restaurant names (e.g., â€œDominoâ€™sâ€)
  * ğŸ’¸ Deals or special offers (e.g., â€œFree Item on \$9 Spendâ€)

### ğŸ› ï¸ CSS Selectors Used:

* **Name Selector**: `div.be.f3.bg.f2.ck.bp.bn.k2` â†’ extracts all names
* **Deal Selector**: `div.hr.bn.k2` â†’ extracts all visible deals

âš™ï¸ You configure it to **get all matches**, not just one. This ensures multiple restaurants are included.

### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» For Beginners:

* This is where **the magic happens** â€” HTML becomes readable data.
* No coding is required â€” just CSS selectors you can get from â€œInspect Elementâ€ in Chrome.
* You can reuse this for other platforms like DoorDash or Grubhub by updating the selectors.

---

ğŸ• Todayâ€™s Top Pizza Deals
